item.title: What do blockchains offer over legacy systems?
item.description:
What do blockchains offer over legacy systems?

Answer: I misread the question but will leave my answer here anyway. Below are the benefits of a decentralized PUBLIC Blockchain like Bitcoin. 1. Censorship resistance: blocking transactions is very difficult & expensive 2. Trustlessness: you do not need to trust any authority regarding the curr...

item.title: The FinTech Explosion is Powered by Millenials - NEWSBTC
item.description:
The FinTech Explosion is Powered by Millenials - NEWSBTC

Millenials, a generation born from 1981 to 2000, represents more than 84 million people in the US alone, they were conceived in the information era, a world filled with electronic devices, and a global communication network (The Internet). FinTech Trends A three-year survey named The Millenial Disruption Index (MDI) covered more than 200 interviews, with more than ...

item.title: Poloniex Goes out for a While, Comes Back up Again - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Poloniex Goes out for a While, Comes Back up Again - NEWSBTC

Poloniex went down earlier today following an outage only to be back in few hours, leading to few anxious hours for its users. Read more... Poloniex, one of the leading cryptocurrency exchanges reported a technical outage earlier today. Following the incident, the company posted a notice on twitter.

item.title: Is Google/Apple interested in Blockchain? Is there some reason that they seem to be silent on this front at least in public?
item.description:
Is Google/Apple interested in Blockchain? Is there some reason that they seem to be silent on this front at least in public?

The greatest evidence for that hypothesis is likely Microsoft's BaaS. They may be silent because much of the public associates Bitcoin and cryptocurrency with crime, money laundering etc. A news title like "Google provides Bitcoin Wallet" can just as easily and more profitably become "Google facilitates the laundering of milllions."

item.title: Blockchain Allows Sneaker Manufacturer To Prevent Counterfeiting
item.description:
Blockchain Allows Sneaker Manufacturer To Prevent Counterfeiting

A sneaker manufacturer has used blockchain technology to create smart tags that can track their sneakers to the factory, so they are impossible to counterfeit, according to fastcodedesign.com. The manufacturer, Greats, tapped the services of a software authentication system and a 3-D printer to design the smart tags.

item.title: Bitcoin Exchanges Could Face New Regulations in the Philippines - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Exchanges Could Face New Regulations in the Philippines - CoinDesk

The central bank of the Philippines is looking to expand oversight of the country's financial system following an embarrassing hack on the SWIFT international transfer system - a move that may ultimately result in new rules for domestic bitcoin services.

item.title: Just convinced my dog to accept Bitcoin instead of treats! * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
Just convinced my dog to accept Bitcoin instead of treats! * /r/Bitcoin

Bitcoin is the currency of the Internet: a distributed, worldwide, decentralized digital money. Unlike traditional currencies such as dollars, bitcoins are issued and managed without any central authority whatsoever: there is no government, company, or bank in charge of Bitcoin. As such, it is more resistant to wild inflation and corrupt banks.

item.title: Bitcoin's Rallying Again-But Isn't Getting Much Attention Anymore
item.description:
Bitcoin's Rallying Again-But Isn't Getting Much Attention Anymore

Even as investors move back into bitcoin, the virtual currency has lost its place in the global spotlight. Bitcoin is a hot investment following an eight-month rally during which the virtual currency has gained about 130%, but it's no longer the hot topic it once was.

item.title: Towards Massive On-Chain Scaling: Block Propagation Results With Xthin
item.description:
Towards Massive On-Chain Scaling: Block Propagation Results With Xthin

Part 4 of 5: Fewer bytes are required to communicate a Xthin block By Andrew Clifford, Peter R. Rizun, @sickpig, Andrew Stone and Peter Tschipper. With special thanks to Jihan Wu from AntPool for the block source and to @cypherdoc and our other generous donors for the funds to pay for our nodes in Mainland China.

item.title: Bitcoin Developers Meet in Zürich for High-Stakes Code Review - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Developers Meet in Zürich for High-Stakes Code Review - CoinDesk

A group of contributors to the open-source Bitcoin Core development project met late last month in Switzerland for a sit-down review of the code for Segregated Witness, a proposal aimed at scaling the bitcoin network.
